title: Boy, 4, is in counselling after being ‘forced to kiss other boy during spin the bottle’ at daycare

A mother claimed her four-year-old son was forced into kissing another boy during a "sickening" game of spin the bottle at his playgroup . 
The woman, called Dominique Green, claims her child was coerced into "sexualised acts" which were filmed and posted onto Snapchat . 
Dominique says she was sickened when she discovered nursery workers had been playing the game with their kids. 
The game involves spinning a bottle twice to see who the cap points to, and then those two people are supposed to kiss. 
She was sent a clip of him kissing another boy, which had been uploaded by an employee of Little Angels Daycare in Oklahoma, US. The video showed the kids apparently playing spin the bottle (Photo: KFor.com) Dominique claims her son was forced into kissing the young boy (Photo: KFor.com) 
In the clip, the children appear to be spinning the bottle on the table. 
Next, Dominique's son is seen hugging and apparently kissing another boy from the group. Read More Nursery closed after damning report finds children given medication without parent's consent and 'illegal' supervision ratios 
The caption on the video alleges the children were being "forced" to kiss each other. 
Dominique said she's angry that the video has also been shared widely on social media, reports the Sun. She said it was "sickening" to watch the Snapchat video (Photo: KFor.com) 
She told NewsChannel4: "It’s sickening for a mother to watch that, and I just sit back and don’t say anything about it? 
"It’s already on social media. So, everybody has seen my son being bullied and doing sexual things. It’s just crazy." The Little Angels Daycare said one of the staff members involved has left the company (Photo: KFor.com) Read More 
The mum also claims an employee at the nursery said they "didn't see anything wrong" with encouraging the children to play the game. Like us on Facebook
